author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Delhi Police’s Special Investigation Team (SIT) is marking all “ambiguous” portions in the All India Institute of Medical Science report on Sunanda Pushkar’s death in the hope of getting more clarity.

A highly-placed police source said the “ambiguous” portions of the report will be sent back to AIIMS for further clarification. This is set to delay the ongoing investigation by nearly three months.

Police Commissioner B.S. Bassi had taken to Twitter on Friday to reveal that the police had received the report of AIIMS findings on the FBI’s forensic report on the Sunanda’s visceral samples. She had died under mysterious circumstances in January two years ago. Speaking to the journalists later, Mr. Bassi had said while Sunanda’s death was unnatural, there was uncertainty on the poisonous substance that killed her. The United States-based FBI lab report had ruled out polonium or any other radioactive poisoning substances as the cause of death.

Since the FBI reports were “inconclusive”, the police had sent them to the AIIMS forensic experts to analyse if any of the chemicals mentioned in the FBI report caused Pushkar’s death.

However, as there are lot of “technical points” which are beyond the police’s understanding, the AIIMS report has failed to help the investigators, prompting them to plan to return the report to AIIMS for clarifications.
title: Sunanda case: police to seek clarification
